ucigame
Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
  ucigame.Sprite

public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object

A Sprite object is an image that can be moved around in the game window. Ucigame uses many kinds of sprites: they can be stationary; they can cycle between multiple images, and they can act like buttons and be sensitive to mouse clicks. Sprites can have text written on them, and multiple sprites can be "pinned" together so that when one moves the pinned Sprites follow.

Constructor Detail

Sprite

public Sprite(Image image)
Creates a Sprite with the same width and height as the specified Image. Usually used for creating Sprites with a single image.

Sprite

public Sprite(int cols,
              int rows,
              int tileWidth,
              int tileHeight)
Creates a tiled Sprite with the specified number of rows and columns. Each tile has the specified width and height. The Sprite can have any positive number of columns and rows. The Sprite's tiles are are assigned images with setTiles().

Sprite

public Sprite(int w,
              int h)
Creates a Sprite with the specified width and height.

Sprite

public Sprite(Image image,
              int width,
              int height)
Creates a Sprite based on the specified Image object, with the specified width and height. If width specified is larger than image's width, and/or height specified is larger than image's height, then the image will be tiled to cover the complete Sprite.

Method Detail

addFrame

public void addFrame(Image image,
                     int x,
                     int y)
Adds a frame to the Sprite. Each time the sprite is displayed on the canvas with draw(), it will automatically cycle to the next frame. The x and y parameters specify the upper left hand corner of a rectangle in the image that will be sprite's next frame. The width and height of that rectangle are same as the sprite's width and height.

addFrames

public void addFrames(Image image,
                      int... locations)
A variant of addFrame() which allows multiple frames from one Image object to be added to the sprite with one method call.

setTiles

public void setTiles(Image gameImage,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     int... locations)
Takes a frame from gameImage (with an upper left hand corner as specified by x and y and with width and height as specified in makeTiledSprite()), and puts that frame into one or more of the sprite's tiles as specified by the col and row pairs specified by location. (location must be of even length; each pair of numbers is used to indicate a column and row in the sprite's matrix. Note that counting columns and rows starts from zero, and that position (0, 0) is in the matrix's upper right hand corner. This method can only be used if the sprite was created with makeTiledSprite.

pin

public void pin(Sprite pinnedSprite,
                int x,
                int y)
Pins pinnedSprite on top of current sprite (this), which means that pinnedSprite will be drawn whenever this.draw() is performed. The upper left hand corner of pinnedSprite is located x pixels to the right and y pixels below the upper left hand corner of this; thus pinnedSprite moves when this is moved. Any number of other sprites can be pinned to a sprite. A sprite cannot be pinned to itself. If a sprite is hidden, all sprites pinned to it are hidden.

framerate

public void framerate(int d)
Sets a framerate for this sprite; Ucigame will try to change the sprite's current frame number d times per second, although there is no guarantee that it will be successful. This method has no effect if d is negative or greater than the framerate specified for the entire game.

rotate

public void rotate(double degrees)
Rotates the sprite counterclockwise by the number of degrees specified. The center of rotation is the center of the sprite. Any sprites pinned to this sprite are also rotated around the same center of rotation. Note that rotation occurs immediately before sprite.draw() is executed, no matter when the call to rotate() is made (as long as rotate() is called before draw()). This means that rotation does not affect collision detection; collision detection is computed on the unrotated sprite. (Defined as a feature, but could well be a bug.) After draw() is called on a sprite any rotation is removed; thus if a sprite should be rotated in every frame rotate() must be called before each draw().

rotate

public void rotate(double degrees,
                   double rotCenterX,
                   double rotCenterY)
Same as the one parameter version of rotate(), except that the center of rotation is rotCenterX pixels to the right and rotCenterY pixels down from the upper left hand corner of the sprite.

flipHorizontal

public void flipHorizontal()
Flips the sprite around a vertical line running through the center of the sprite. Any sprites pinned to this sprite are also flipped around the same line. Note that flipping occurs immediately before sprite.draw() is executed, no matter when the call to flipHorizontal() is made (as long as flipHorizontal() is called before draw()). This means that flipHorizontal does not affect collision detection; collision detection is computed on the unflipped sprite. (Defined as a feature, but could well be a bug.) After draw() is called on a sprite any flipping is removed; thus if a sprite should be flipped in every frame FlipHorizontal() must be called before each draw().

flipVertical

public void flipVertical()
Flips the sprite around a horizontal line running through the center of the sprite. Any sprites pinned to this sprite are also flipped around the same line. Note that flipping occurs immediately before sprite.draw() is executed, no matter when the call to flipVertical() is made (as long as flipVertical() is called before draw()). This means that flipVertical does not affect collision detection; collision detection is computed on the unflipped sprite. (Defined as a feature, but could well be a bug.) After draw() is called on a sprite any flipping is removed; thus if a sprite should be flipped in every frame FlipVertical() must be called before each draw().

defineSequence

public void defineSequence(java.lang.String sequenceName,
                           int... frameIndices)
Defines, for an animated sprite, a sequence of one or more animation frames, which can later be cycled through while the sprite is displayed. The sequenceName cannot be "All" as the name "All" is reserved to refer to the sequence of all frames in the order they were specified with addFrame() or addFrames(). The frameIndices specify the frames in the sequence. A frame's index is based on the order it was added to the sprite with addFrame() or addFrames(); the first frame has index 0. A frame index may be repeated in the list of frameIndices.

currSequence

public java.lang.String currSequence()
Returns the name of the sprite's current sequence. If no squence has been specified (with play()), the the name of the default sequence "All" is returned.

                 int once)

                 java.lang.String sequenceNameLoop,
                 int once)

                 int repetitions,
                 java.lang.String sequenceNameLoop)

                 int repetitions,
                 java.lang.String sequenceNameLoop,
                 int once)

public void restart()

setToFrame

public void setToFrame(int frameSequence)

draw

public void draw()
Causes the sprite, and any other sprites pinned to this sprite, to be drawn on the canvas, unless the sprite is hidden. Can only be called inside the game class's draw() method.

font

                 int _style,
                 int _size)
This method specifies the font to use in subsequent calls to sprite1.putText().

                 int _g,
                 int _b)

putText

public void putText(int _n,
                    double _x,
                    double _y)
Draws the specified int on the sprite, using the sprite's current font. The lower left hand corner of text is located x pixels to the right and y pixels below the upper left hand corner of sprite1. Any part of text that lies outside the sprite is clipped (not displayed).

putText

public void putText(double _d,
                    double _x,
                    double _y)

putText

public void putText(java.lang.String _string,
                    double _x,
                    double _y)
Draws the specified text on the sprite, using the sprite's current font. The lower left hand corner of text is located x pixels to the right and y pixels below the upper left hand corner of sprite1. Any part of text that lies outside the sprite is clipped (not displayed).

public boolean isShown()
Check to make sure the sprite is set to be visible.

position

public void position(double _x,
                     double _y)
Moves the sprite so that its upper left hand corner is at the specified position, relative to the upper left hand corner of the canvas (or to the upper left hand corner of its parent, if this sprite is pinned).

motion

public void motion(double _x,
                   double _y)
Sets the x and y motion amount for this sprite. See move().

motion

public void motion(double _x,
                   double _y,
                   int _COMMAND)
Change the motion amount base on the command provided.

move

public void move()
Moves the sprite by its x and y motion amounts. Typically this method is called once for every moving sprite, before collision detection.

x

public double x()

y

public double y()

xPixel

public int xPixel()
This method returns the x value of the sprite's upper left hand corner (relative to the upper left hand corner of the canvas).

Returns:
the x value of the sprite's upper left hand corner

yPixel

public int yPixel()
This method returns the y values of the sprite's upper left hand corner (relative to the upper left hand corner of the canvas).

Returns:
the y value of the sprite's upper left hand corner

nextX

public void nextX(double _nextX)
Sets the sprite's next x positions (relative to the upper left hand corner of the canvas). This method is usually used instead of move(), but like move() is called before collision detection and before draw(). Calling this method sets the sprite's x motion amounts to 0.

Parameters:
_nextX - the next x value for the sprite

nextY

public void nextY(double _nextY)
Sets the sprite's next y positions (relative to the upper left hand corner of the canvas). This method is usually used instead of move(), but like move() is called before collision detection and before draw(). Calling this method sets the sprite's y motion amounts to 0.

Parameters:
_nextY - the next y value for the sprite

xspeed

public double xspeed()
This methods return the sprite's current x change amounts.

Returns:
the sprite's x change amount

yspeed

public double yspeed()
This methods return the sprite's current y change amounts.

collided

public boolean collided(int... sides)
Returns a boolean value of true or false, depending on whether an collision was detected in the immediately preceeding xxxIfCollidesWith() call.

makeButton

public void makeButton(java.lang.String _name)
Makes a button with the specified name.

buttonAction

public final void buttonAction(char _action,
                               int _x,
                               int _y)

bounceIfCollidesWith

public void bounceIfCollidesWith(Sprite... _sprite)
This method tests whether this sprite overlaps with the sprite passed in and bounce if collision occurs.

stopIfCollidesWith

public void stopIfCollidesWith(Sprite... _sprite)
This method tests whether this sprite overlaps with the sprite passed in and stop movement if collision occurs.

checkIfCollidesWith

public void checkIfCollidesWith(Sprite... _sprite)
Like the other xxxIfCollidesWith() methods, this methods test whether the two sprites will overlap in the next x and y positions. However, this methods don't change the position or motion of either sprite. The programmer can then test whether an overlap occurred with collided() and code the desired behavior.

pauseIfCollidesWith

public void pauseIfCollidesWith(Sprite... _sprite)
This method tests whether this sprite overlaps with the sprite passed in and pauses. Pausing means that sprite1 moves as far as possible without overlapping sprite2, and its x and y motion amounts are unchanged.

toString

public final java.lang.String toString()
non-API
